name: SpringHill Suites Mystic Waterford

reviews.text: Just returned from a 2 week road trip in New England where we stayed at various Marriott and Hilton hotels along the way. Was disappointed with this property - it certainly did not seem "new" as other reviews suggested. Queen beds are more like double beds. Only one washer and dryer in the laundry room. Even though this was one of the cheaper hotels we stayed at, I would say we got better value for money at other hotels with the same star rating. Therefore, I would not stay at this property again.
reviews.title: Very basic hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights and had a very good experience. The hotel is centrally located, was very clean and the breakfast was phenomenal and it varied daily. The staff was eager to please and very accomodating when extra towels and soaps were needed.
reviews.title: Clean, great breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Travelling from Albany NY to Waterford CT we had car trouble and only just managed to nurse the car back home. So we called the hotel and cancelled our reservation - at 6:40pm and as a coutesy they waived the usual fee. But less than 2 hours later we had a replacment car and called ahead asking if we could still have a room. The staff we dealt with on the front desk were polite and professional in all of this. We eventully arrived and checked in at 11:30pm - very tired and a little stressed.
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.text: The room was huge with 2 doubles, a mini kithchen and off set sitting area. 2 TVs. We had a little trouble with the digital key but it was reset and it worked. This was my first stay at a Springhill Suite and I was pleasantly surprised. Really close to the Ferry if you want to go to Orient on Long Island - which we did.
reviews.title: Wonderful Surprise!

reviews.text: Breakfast had the standard range of hot and cold items.
reviews.title: Ok, but not great for the price.
Honest employees
reviews.text: Very nice friendly hotel the staff was very helpful there was one particular person his name was Ron this guy was great we wanted ice for a a cooler so we needed more than usual because the cooler was big this guy gave us big buckets and then he came up with putting a plastic bag in a mop bucket and that did the job I offered him money he said that's not necessary it was my pleasure to help you so I think Ron who every hotel should have one give employee of the year to him we need more Ron's out there.

My friend and I stayed here during a weekend visit to the Coast Guard Academy. The hotel is clean and the management very nice. Our room was quiet and clean as well. The breakfast buffet was very sufficient, with a nice ambiance with a fireplace. Although it was April, it was a cold and sometimes rainy so a nice warm fire was definitely a great touch.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here on a recent weekend while attending a function at the Coast Guard Academy. The hotel was full of families but our room on the third floor was quiet and the bed was very comfortable. The manager is friendly and welcoming and makes you happy to meet him. I understand he has been there awhile. Also there was hot oatmeal for breakfast, along with more usual offerings of eggs, cereal, bagels etc. Only warm water was available in the morning, as we tried to shower and shave along with many other guests. The furniture is a bit worn and the shower head let water through 2/3 of the openings. The hotel is adjacent to an empty pad in a shopping center, but also is within easy walking distance of both a Chili's and a Chucky Cheese.
reviews.title: Friendly and accomodating but very busy

reviews.text: Twenty three of us went there for my mother's 66th Birthday since we planned to also go to the Mohegan Sun Casino. We loved it! The right price and superior quality in service and amenities for what little we paid.
reviews.title: Best Kept Secret.....

reviews.text: Although it was not GTL(gym, tan and laundry)....it sure was FPG (food, pool and gym) What fun the family had that weekend...from the 66 year old to the 5 year old!
reviews.title: Good, Basic Hotel Near Connecticut College

reviews.text: This hotel offers more than just a comfortable bed and fast Internet -- it offers true hospitality! Everyone -- from the managers to the maintenance man to the housekeepers -- is genuinely kind and interested in making your stay as nice as possible. At a chain hotel, this is a nice surprise. The level of interest the staff shows in their guests is something I've normally found only at small, independent hotels and hostels. This was especially welcomed given that my stay at this hotel was due to a massive storm-related power outage.
reviews.title: True hospitality on offer

reviews.text: Rooms are spotless, comfortable and nicely decorated with two flat screen TVs and piping hot showers. Although the rooms will be renovated in a couple months (according to the manager), I honestly think they're fine as they are; they definitely don't feel dated.
reviews.title: Conn College/CGA regattas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Decent location near a Chili's, large shopping center and Coast Guard Academy/Connecticut College.
reviews.title: Average for Marriott

reviews.text: With reasonable rates, this is probably the best value hotel in the New London/Waterford/Mystic region...certainly the nicest hotel in New London.
reviews.title: Nice hotel near Mystic

reviews.text: The rooms are a nice size but they do need some updating. The textiles and colors are dreary.
reviews.title: Good value in New London

reviews.text: My friend and I stayed here after the Jimmy Buffett show in the area. My friend due to his business stays is a Platinum member and received our stay as a complimentary room. The Hotel is very new, off 95 South a bit, so it can be a little hard to find, and the site won't register with older GPS units. Overall, it is a nice property with a friendly staff. The suites are large and clean. A complimentary bag of Sun Chips and Water were left in the room. The bath products were of very good quality (for example, Paul Mitchell Shampoo), and the beds were comfortable and their were two flat screens in the divided space, as well as a desk and wet bar sink. We both had the hot breakfast in the morning. Plenty to choose from: Oatmeal, Eggs, Sausage, Make your own waffles, and muffins, toast, bagels, cereals, etc. The area was clean, well stocked, and the hot food choices and coffee were hot and tasty. The site has a pool and a fitness center that we didn't use, but took a quick glance at, and they appeared decent. Parking on site is complimentary, but the front of the building is a little weird with a fence dividing the main hotel lot from an overflow lot. So, if you have to use the overflow lot, it is not well lit and a bit inconvenient in having to navigate around a high white wooden dividing fence. I do recommend the property for business travelers in the area.
reviews.title: Worth a stay

reviews.text: very clean,fair price manager John was great close to everything in southeast connecticut
reviews.title: great hotel southeast ct

reviews.text: We didn't want to spend to much on an overnight stay that was only 2 hours away, so we selected this hotel staying within the Marriott group. The value ended up being good after we got a major discount for the misfunctioning lock system on our door. This was a huge inconvenience when you have a tired baby on your hands and you can't get into your room. However the staff felt sorry and were as accommodating as they could be. Breakfast was included which helped the value and having a kitchen in your room with a baby is a great thing. Rooms were clean.
reviews.title: Convenient and comfortable

reviews.text: Looks typical from the outside, nice lobby, etc., but tired rooms, and felt a bit dingy. Common areas freezing cold - abnormally so. Hallways and lobby were uncomfortably cold. Lots of highway noise from traffic all night. Disappointing stay.
reviews.title: Only skin deep...

reviews.text: Visiting family for a couple of days, tacked on to a trip to New York.
reviews.title: Nice little suites hotel

aka: Springhill Suites Mystic Waterford Hotel Waterford
